title: Multiple Linear Regression Theorem
contentHtml: The Multiple Linear Regression (MLR) theorem is a fundamental result in statistical modeling.

theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the least squares estimator is unbiased and consistent, then using the Gauss-Markov theorem to conclude that it's also the maximum likelihood estimator.

intuition: This theorem shows how to estimate the coefficients of a linear regression model when there are multiple predictors. It's a powerful tool for modeling complex relationships between variables.
realWorldApplications: Analyzing the impact of marketing campaigns on sales
